title: TAMC Library: COVID-19: Home
author: Pamela Scott
description: COVID-19 pages from TAMC Library subscriptions.
cleaned_text: Refer to this guide for information about current Library Services and curated pages for COVID-19 resources. If you should require assistance or have questions that are not answered here, please feel free to contact the Medical Library staff. The best way to contact the Medical Library staff is to eMail the group. We will field your question and get back to you as quickly as possible. usarmy.tripler.medcom-tamc.list.he-medlib@health.mil The Immunization Healthcare Division in collaboration with the Centers for Disease Control (CDC) presents the COVID-19 Vaccine Training: General Overview of Immunization Best Practices for Health Care Providers Webinar. This COVID-19 Vaccine Training Webinar can be found at the following link: [https://www2.cdc.gov/vaccines/ed/covid19/](https://www2.cdc.gov/vaccines/ed/covid19/) . The webinar is also available for 2.0 Continuing Education (CE)/Continuing Medical Education (CME) credits through the Defense Health Agency, J7, Continuing Education Program Office. To earn CE/CMEs, participants must complete the training on the CDC site, then register at the following link: [https://www.dhaj7-cepo.com/content/covid-19-vaccine-training](https://www.dhaj7-cepo.com/content/covid-19-vaccine-training) and complete both the posttest/evaluation questions. *Event Overview:* The COVID-19 Vaccine Training is a new, web-on-demand, self-paced module for health care providers who will be administering the COVID-19 vaccine. This module provides health care personnel with information about the COVID-19 vaccine Emergency Use Authorization (EUA) and safety, as well as general information about vaccine storage, handling, administration, and reporting. Below are the learning objectives for this home study: 1. Outline methods the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) employs to ensure safety of the COVID-19 vaccine(s). 2. Discuss COVID-19 vaccine EUA, development, and safety protocols. 3. Implement routine and emergency procedures for the proper administration, monitoring, storage and disposal of vaccines. 4. Analyze the standard infection prevention precautions and vaccine preparation protocols in order to reduce risk of contamination. 5. Summarize the information that COVID-19 vaccination providers are required to report to the Vaccine Adverse Event Reporting System (VAERS). *Continuing Education:* CE/CMEs are available for the following health care professionals: Physicians, Nurses, Pharmacists, Pharmacy Technicians, Physician Assistants, Optometrists, Dentists, Dental Hygienists, Dental Lab Technicians, Social Workers, Psychologists, Certified Counselors, Healthcare Executives, Registered Dieticians, and Dietetic Technicians. The DHA, J-7, CEPO awards the credits, which are limited in scope to health care providers who actively provide care to U.S. active-duty service members, reservists, National Guardsmen, military veterans and their families. *Participation:* To view the COVID-19 Vaccine Training on the CDC site, please use the following link: [https://www2.cdc.gov/vaccines/ed/covid19/](https://www2.cdc.gov/vaccines/ed/covid19/) To register for the COVID-19 Vaccine Training in the CMS, please visit the following link: [https://www.dhaj7-cepo.com/content/covid-19-vaccine-training](https://www.dhaj7-cepo.com/content/covid-19-vaccine-training) If you have questions or need assistance, please email: [dha.ncr.j7.mbx.continuing-education-office@mail.mil](mailto:dha.ncr.j7.mbx.continuing-education-office@mail.mil) The Medical Library staff have contacted the outprocessing office and instructed them to waive the outprocessing requirement. You may initial the box for Medical Library on your outprocessing documents yourself. If you have books that have been checked out, please return them to the book drop on the 11th floor hallway. Please return all books to the book drop in the 11th floor hallway. Do not leave books at the front desk in the Library
